title: I don't always see 10 Thunderlord's in a game.
body: But when I do I thumbs up the Riot team for their diverse mastery system of "wow tank masteries fkn suck" and "Even the supports are fkn 12-18-0" and "every time I play this game, both teams all have Thunderlord's".

replies.body:
Ok, firstly, I think Thunderlord's is balanced. I feel like the problem is that most of the other Keystones are underpowered. 

Secondly, the tank masteries are great. Grasp of the Undying is the second most popular and second strongest keystone, it may even be on par with Thunderlord's. Bond of Stone is super strong on Tank Supports and if they aren't grabbing it well then that's their loss. Strength of the Ages is pretty good on Cinderhulk using health tanks, champions who rely on their Health as a resource or damage scaling should always pick it up.

And depending on which support we're discussing here, 12-18-0 isn't terrible. I run it on lane bully champs like Morgana and such.

My friend actually told me the same thing. After they nerfed the Deathfire Touch mastery, it left most mages (and some other champions) with no other viable keystone mastery except Thunderlords. Maybe once the meta develops more, we'll see a shift away from it, but for now, it doesn't look like much will be changing unless the keystones are tweaked a bit.

Deathfire Touch so far, has recieved a buff and a nerf. It took a hit to it's damage over time period, making the damage come in slower, hurting you in all ins. But, it got a slight damage nerf. To be honest, Deathfire never stood a chance against Thunderlords for the majority of the mages in the game. It's a niche pick for sustained single target champs and DoT champs.
